sub_title: DESIGN, PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT, SOURCING, FASHION BUSINESS & MANAGEMENT.
summary:
I, aspire to be a part of the beautiful culture and make my mark in the field of fashion business.I come from a place that's rich with knowledge and experience. Bangladesh remains the second largest apparel exporter in the world.  I've come a long way from tracing simple measurement charts to creating tangible forms out of ideas laid down by teams with over 16 members.  

I have started my MSc Fashion Business and Management in UCA, UK.  Attaining this higher education from University for the Creative Arts (UCA) will become my gateway to enhancing my social and business relationships along with establishing a better idea on the global trends.  

I've graduated from the renowned BGMEA Institute of Fashion and Technology, Dhaka. I completed MBA in Apparel merchandising and B.Sc. in Fashion designing and Technology, and these have helped me come a long way in my professional experiences.

Currently, I'm working with the Centro, Dhaka as the Head of Design and Product Development. Every jot and tittle from sales, sample grouping, packaging, labelling, grid planning, trend researching, idea conceptualisation, trimming to presenting the line and collection to the clients was supervised by me and executed to perfection. 

Working with a line of brands across the country I've familiarised myself with the many cultures, trends, and customer needs. From the Zara store in Spain, Puma in Germany, Marks & Spencer and Primark in UK, Aeropostale in USA, Just Jeans in Australia, Woolworth in South Africa and the Landmark in UAE. You could name a brand, and I would've worked or collaborated with them at some point. 

I've hustled across the ramp for brands to put out nothing but the best. While I'm at it, I've also ensured that every bit of fabric we put together is ethically sourced and of sustainable nature. The idea of sourcing sustainable goods was something I built over the time and it has definitely seen some positive results. 

My references can vouch for it when I say that I am very self-reliant. If they wanted to source new suppliers, explain product lines, supervise showrooms, determine client requirements, come up with developmental sketches and concept techniques, or even quote the right prices - I was the one they could count on without a second opinion. That's the brand I've created for myself over the 13 years of professional work in Fashion Designing and product development.
